title: Get Medieval - BlissBoy
description:
"Runescape is for wimps..!!"

"This game boils your blood, are you and your friends all over the world up to this challenge..?"

Get medieval's trailer:   <a href="
http://www.getmedieval.com/gm_320.mov" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.getmedieval.com/gm_320.mov</a>


Irresistibly addictive, Get Medieval immerses you in a frenetic action environment as you battle the evil minions of a dastardly dragon. Laugh out loud at the quips, quibbles, and quirks of this slightly "off" band of adventurers. And while you may not want these characters to show up at your next dinner party, you'll forgive their eccentricities when their diverse but effective skills get you through to the next level.

With great muliplayer options including - two players on the same keyboard, daisy-chained sidewinders, Internet and LAN support, we're sure you can find a way to get your friends involved, whether they're across the street or across the continent. 



Beautiful 3D rendered graphics 
40 "hand-built" action-packed levels with the option to use the advanced Random Dungeon Generator to create new levels for unlimited gameplay 
Over 20 different enemies and bosses 
4 different characters to choose from, each well-balanced using their respective strengths and weaknesses (e.g. weapon strength, speed, etc.) 
8 artifact powerups that give the characters special abilities 
Up to 4 players can play on one machine or via network to cooperatively explore and clear levels 
Downloadable from the Get Medieval web site is Monolith's DungeonEdit that enable players to build their own custom levels from the ground up 
Spectacular audio, with panning/fading ambient and trigger sound effects and unique music for each level 
Windows(tm) 95 native 
All the art is beautifully rendered in 3D using 16-bit color and high resolution graphics (640x480) 
Dynamic color filters for amazing special effects, including active lighting and translucent images 
Playable on the Internet, over a LAN or via a modem 
Uses Microsoft's DirectX(tm) technology for superior performance and hardware compatibility 
Uses Monolith's advanced 2D parallaxing game engine WAP
